metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12768 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - negligible
metadata.Description:
** DISPUTED ** An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.6.svm_cpu_uninit in arch/x86/kvm/svm.c has a memory leak, akaCID-d80b64ff297e. NOTE: third parties dispute this issue because it's aone-time leak at the boot, the size is negligible, and it can't betriggered at will.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12768` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-62-generic - 5.3.0-62.56~18.04.1
linux-image-5.3.0-62-generic-lpae - 5.3.0-62.56~18.04.1
